00001 /* bpred-perceptron.cpp: The original perceptron predictor [Jimenez and Lin, ACM TOCS 2002] */
00002 /*
00003  * __COPYRIGHT__ GT
00004  */
00005 
00006 #include <math.h>
00007 #define COMPONENT_NAME "perceptron"
00008 
00009 #ifdef BPRED_PARSE_ARGS
00010 if(!strcasecmp(COMPONENT_NAME,type))
00011 {
00012   int his_width; /* bhr history length */
00013   int top_size; /* top = Table of Perceptrons, i.e., total number of perceptrons */
00014 
00015   if(sscanf(opt_string,"%*[^:]:%[^:]:%d:%d",name,&his_width,&top_size) != 3)
00016     fatal("bad bpred options string %s (should be \"perceptron:name:his_width:top_size\")",opt_string);
00017   return new bpred_perceptron_t(name,his_width,top_size);
00018 }
00019 #else
00020 
00021 #define BIPOLAR(x) (((x)<<1)-1)
00022 //#define BIPOLAR(x) (2*(x)-1)
00023 
00024 class bpred_perceptron_t:public bpred_dir_t
00025 {
00026 
00027   class bpred_perceptron_sc_t:public bpred_sc_t
00028   {
00029     public:
00030     short* top_entry;
00031     int sum;
00032     /* contents of bhr at lookup (used for update and recovery) */
00033     qword_t lookup_bhr;
00034     qword_t lookup_bhr_old;
00035   };
00036 
00037   protected:
00038 
00039   qword_t bhr;
00040   qword_t bhr_old;
00041 
00042   int top_size;
00043   int top_mask;
00044   short **top; /* table of perceptrons */
00045   int weight_width;
00046   int weight_max;
00047   int weight_min;
00048   int theta;
00049 
00050   int history_length;
00051 
00052   public:
00053 
00054 
00055   /* CREATE */
00056   bpred_perceptron_t(char * const arg_name,
00057                      const int arg_history_length,
00058                      const int arg_top_size
00059                     )
00060   {
00061     init();
00062 
00063     /* verify arguments are valid */
00064     CHECK_NNEG(arg_history_length);
00065     CHECK_PPOW2(arg_top_size);
00066 
00067     name = strdup(arg_name);
00068     if(!name)
00069       fatal("couldn't malloc perceptron name (strdup)");
00070     type = strdup(COMPONENT_NAME);
00071     if(!type)
00072       fatal("couldn't malloc perceptron type (strdup)");
00073 
00074     history_length = arg_history_length;
00075 
00076     top_size = arg_top_size;
00077     top_mask = arg_top_size-1;
00078 
00079     /* see Dan Jimenez's HPCA paper for these magic formulae */
00080     theta = (int) rint(floor(1.93*history_length + 14.0));
00081 
00082     /* if power of two, then actually need an extra bit to represent.
00083        also add one bit for the sign. */
00084     if(theta == (1<<log_base2(theta)))
00085       weight_width = log_base2(theta)+2;
00086     else
00087       weight_width = log_base2(theta)+1;
00088 
00089     weight_max = (1<<(weight_width-1))-1;
00090     weight_min = -(1<<(weight_width-1));
00091 
00092     bhr = 0;
00093     bhr_old = 0;
00094     top = (short**) calloc(top_size,sizeof(*top));
00095     if(!top)
00096       fatal("couldn't malloc perceptron ToP");
00097     for(int i=0;i<top_size;i++)
00098     {
00099       top[i] = (short*) calloc(1+history_length,sizeof(*top[i]));
00100       if(!top[i])
00101         fatal("couldn't malloc perceptron ToP entry");
00102     }
00103 
00104     bits =  history_length
00105          + top_size*(history_length+1)*weight_width;
00106   }
00107 
00108   /* DESTROY */
00109   ~bpred_perceptron_t()
00110   {
00111     for(int i=0;i<top_size;i++)
00112     {
00113       free(top[i]);
00114       top[i] = NULL;
00115     }
00116     free(top); top = NULL;
00117   }
00118 
00119   /* LOOKUP */
00120   BPRED_LOOKUP_HEADER
00121   {
00122     class bpred_perceptron_sc_t * sc = (class bpred_perceptron_sc_t*) scvp;
00123     bool pred;
00124     int top_index = PC&top_mask;
00125 
00126     sc->top_entry = top[top_index];
00127     sc->sum = sc->top_entry[0];
00128 
00129     for(int i=0;i<history_length;i++)
00130     {
00131       int hist_dir;
00132       if(i<64) hist_dir = BIPOLAR((bhr>>i)&1);
00133       else     hist_dir = BIPOLAR((bhr_old>>(i-64))&1);
00134       sc->sum += sc->top_entry[i+1]*hist_dir;
00135     }
00136 
00137     pred = sc->sum >= 0;
00138     sc->lookup_bhr_old = bhr_old;
00139     sc->lookup_bhr = bhr;
00140 
00141     BPRED_STAT(lookups++;)
00142     sc->updated = false;
00143 
00144     return pred;
00145   }
00146 
00147   /* UPDATE */
00148   BPRED_UPDATE_HEADER
00149   {
00150     class bpred_perceptron_sc_t * sc = (class bpred_perceptron_sc_t*) scvp;
00151 
00152     if((((sc->sum >=0)?1:0) != outcome) ||
00153        ((sc->sum < theta) && (sc->sum > -theta)))
00154     {
00155       if(outcome) {
00156           if(sc->top_entry[0] < weight_max) sc->top_entry[0]++;
00157       } else {
00158           if(sc->top_entry[0] > weight_min) sc->top_entry[0]--;
00159       }
00160       for(int i=0;i<history_length;i++)
00161       {
00162         int hist_bit;
00163         if(i<64) hist_bit = (sc->lookup_bhr>>i)&1;
00164         else     hist_bit = (sc->lookup_bhr_old>>(i-64))&1;
00165         if(hist_bit == outcome) {
00166           if(sc->top_entry[i+1] < weight_max) sc->top_entry[i+1]++;
00167         } else {
00168           if(sc->top_entry[i+1] > weight_min) sc->top_entry[i+1]--;
00169         }
00170       }
00171     }
00172 
00173     if(!sc->updated)
00174     {
00175       BPRED_STAT(updates++;)
00176       BPRED_STAT(num_hits += our_pred == outcome;)
00177       sc->updated = true;
00178     }
00179   }
00180 
00181   /* SPEC_UPDATE */
00182   BPRED_SPEC_UPDATE_HEADER
00183   {
00184     BPRED_STAT(spec_updates++;)
00185 
00186     bhr_old = (bhr_old<<1)|((bhr>>63)&1);
00187     bhr = (bhr<<1)|our_pred;
00188   }
00189 
00190   /* RECOVER */
00191   BPRED_RECOVER_HEADER
00192   {
00193     class bpred_perceptron_sc_t * sc = (class bpred_perceptron_sc_t*) scvp;
00194     bhr_old = (sc->lookup_bhr_old<<1)|(sc->lookup_bhr<1);
00195     bhr = (sc->lookup_bhr<<1)|outcome;
00196   }
00197 
00198   /* FLUSH */
00199   BPRED_FLUSH_HEADER
00200   {
00201     class bpred_perceptron_sc_t * sc = (class bpred_perceptron_sc_t*) scvp;
00202     bhr_old = sc->lookup_bhr_old;
00203     bhr = sc->lookup_bhr;
00204   }
00205 
00206   /* REG_STATS */
00207   BPRED_REG_STATS_HEADER
00208   {
00209     bpred_dir_t::reg_stats(sdb,core);
00210 
00211     int id = core?core->current_thread->id:0;
00212     char buf[256];
00213     char buf2[256];
00214 
00215     sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.threshold",id,name);
00216     sprintf(buf2,"%s training threshold",type);
00217     stat_reg_int(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &theta, theta, NULL);
00218     sprintf(buf,"c%d.%s.weight_width",id,name);
00219     sprintf(buf2,"%s weight/counter width in bits",type);
00220     stat_reg_int(sdb, true, buf, buf2, &weight_width, weight_width, NULL);
00221   }
00222 
00223   /* GET_CACHE */
00224   BPRED_GET_CACHE_HEADER
00225   {
00226     class bpred_perceptron_sc_t * sc = new bpred_perceptron_sc_t();
00227     if(!sc)
00228       fatal("couldn't malloc perceptron State Cache");
00229     return sc;
00230   }
00231 
00232 };
00233 
00234 #undef BIPOLAR
00235 #endif /* BPRED_PARSE_ARGS */
00236 #undef COMPONENT_NAME
